intro: Ruschia spathulata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed Ruschia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, star-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its drought tolerance and low maintenance requirements, it is well-suited for arid and semi-arid climates.
